intro: Elytrigia intermedia var. kopetdagi, commonly known as Kopetdag grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, sandy or stony soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. Its inflorescence is a loose panicle, bearing small, two-lipped florets. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and is sometimes used in restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
